How Many Cups Do I Need?
How Many Cups Do I Need?

Overview:
Overview:

– Teaches participants about the recommended amounts
– Teaches participants about the recommended amounts

of fruits and vegetables based on mypyramid.gov.
of fruits and vegetables based on mypyramid.gov.

– Participants will learn
– Participants will learn

• Range of cups of f/v adults need for good health • How to determine the amount of f/v they personally need

• How to determine the amount of f/v they personally need

based on age, gender and physical activity level.
based on age, gender and physical activity level.

• Introduces the concepts of eating measured cups of f/v.
• Introduces the concepts of eating measured cups of f/v.

Learning Objective 1:
Learning Objective 1:

Identify the recommended cups of fruits and vegetables they should eat each day for good health. The recommendations are:
Identify the recommended cups of fruits and
vegetables they should eat each day for good
health. The recommendations are:

• 3½ to 6½ cups of fruits and vegetables every day for good
• 3½ to 6½ cups of fruits and vegetables every day for good

health.

• Amount needed depends on:

Learning Objective 2:
Learning Objective 2:

Recognize how different quantities of fruits and vegetables add up to the recommended daily amount.
Recognize how different quantities of fruits and
vegetables add up to the recommended daily
amount.

What Counts as 1 Cup? • 2 medium carrots • 1 large tomato • 3 broccoli spears What Counts as Half a Cup? • 1 watermelon wedge • 10 string beans • 1 medium orange
What Counts as 1 Cup?
• 2 medium carrots
• 1 large tomato
• 3 broccoli spears
What Counts as Half a Cup?
• 1 watermelon wedge
• 10 string beans
• 1 medium orange

Learning Objective 2 cont…
Learning Objective 2 cont…

All fruits and vegetables count: • Fresh = 1 cup raw leafy greens • Dried = 1/4 cup of dried fruit • 100% juice = 3/4 cup(6oz) of fruit or vegetable juice • Frozen • Canned fruits and vegetables

Learning Objective 3:
Learning Objective 3:

Recognize the role that fruits and vegetables play in reducing their risk of certain chronic diseases.
Recognize the role that fruits and vegetables play in
reducing their risk of certain chronic diseases.

Fruits and vegetables help you maintain: • A healthy heart • Vision health • A lower risk of some cancers
Fruits and vegetables help you maintain:
• A healthy heart
• Vision health
• A lower risk of some cancers

Learning Objective 4:
Learning Objective 4:

Recognize fruit and vegetable consumption as an important element of a healthy lifestyle.
Recognize fruit and vegetable consumption as an
important element of a healthy lifestyle.

They also help you: • Control your weight • Look and feel great • Boost your energy level
They also help you:
• Control your weight
• Look and feel great
• Boost your energy level

Learning Objective 5:
Learning Objective 5:

Use the Fruit and Vegetable Scoreboard handout to track their progress toward meeting their recommended cups of fruits and vegetables.
Use the Fruit and Vegetable Scoreboard handout
to track their progress toward meeting their
recommended cups of fruits and vegetables.

• Ask participants to set weekly goals • Ask participants to keep track of their progress • Mention how social support can make it easier

How Many Minutes Should I Get?
How Many Minutes Should I
Get?

Overview: – Teaches participants about the recommended levels of
Overview:
– Teaches participants about the recommended levels of

physical activity based on mypyramid.gov.
physical activity based on mypyramid.gov.

– Participants should learn:
– Participants should learn:

• Amount of physical activity needed for good health. • Benefits of 30-60-90 minutes of physical activity. • Introduces the concept of moderate vs. vigorous intensity
• Amount of physical activity needed for good health.
• Benefits of 30-60-90 minutes of physical activity.
• Introduces the concept of moderate vs. vigorous intensity

physical activity
physical activity

Learning Objective 1
Learning Objective 1

Identify the recommended minutes of daily physical activity they should do for good health.
Identify the recommended minutes of daily
physical activity they should do for good health.

• Recall the physical activity recommendations
• Recall the physical activity recommendations

– 30 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity = helps maintain good health and reduces risk for chronic disease. – 60 minutes of moderate- to vigorous-intensity physical activity
– 30 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity = helps
maintain good health and reduces risk for chronic disease.
– 60 minutes of moderate- to vigorous-intensity physical activity

– 60 to 90 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity =
– 60 to 90 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity =

= weight loss.
= weight loss.

weight maintenance.
weight maintenance.

Learning Objective 1: Review the definitions of:
Learning Objective 1:
Review the definitions of:

What is moderate-intensity physical activity?
What is moderate-intensity physical activity?

– Activity that gets you up and moving and makes your heart beat faster. Brisk walking, biking, taking the stairs, dancing, and raking leaves.
– Activity that gets you up and moving and makes your heart beat faster.
Brisk walking, biking, taking the stairs, dancing, and raking leaves. B r i s k

b i k i n g ,
t a k i n g
t h e
s t a i r s ,
d a n c i n g ,
a n d
r a k i n g
l e a v e s .

What is vigorous-intensity physical activity?
What is vigorous-intensity physical activity?

– Activity that makes you breathe hard and sweat. Running, jogging, playing
– Activity that makes you breathe hard and sweat. Running, jogging, playing

soccer, fast dancing, and fast biking.
soccer, fast dancing, and fast biking.

Learning Objective 2
Learning Objective 2

Recognize the role that physical activity plays in reducing their risk of certain chronic diseases.
Recognize the role that physical activity plays
in reducing their risk of certain chronic
diseases. d i s e a s e s .

• Adults need at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity physical
• Adults need at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity physical

activity every day to reduce the risk of chronic diseases. • Doing moderate-intensity physical activity on a regular basis: – Lowers your risk for type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure,
activity every day to reduce the risk of chronic diseases.
• Doing moderate-intensity physical activity on a regular basis:
– Lowers your risk for type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure,

heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancer.
heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancer.

Learning Objective 3
Learning Objective 3

Recognize physical activity as an important element of a healthy lifestyle.
Recognize physical activity as an
important element of a healthy lifestyle.

a c t i v i t y ( H - 7 )

– Makes you look and feel great – Gives you more energy – Lowers stress and helps you relax – Lowers your risk of type 2 diabetes – Helps achieve and maintain a healthy body weight – Helps build and keep healthy bones, muscles, and joints
– Makes you look and feel great
– Gives you more energy
– Lowers stress and helps you relax
– Lowers your risk of type 2 diabetes
– Helps achieve and maintain a healthy body weight
– Helps build and keep healthy bones, muscles, and joints

Learning Objective 4:

Things to remember
